item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Ruby:

Why’d you only laugh when you’re high?

Me, I’m high? I’m high on Coca cola, since I just broke my fast. GOD, IT FEELS SO GOOD TO BE ABLE TO DRINK AND EAT!

item.title: Ramadan Kareem Everyone!
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:21, topic:544424”][quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=663304.msg4433127#msg4433127 date=1404158494]

What’s Ramadan Kareem?

Ramadan (a month in the Islamic calendar) is when Muslims fast.
I’m fasting today It’s really hard, since in the summer the sun sets really late, which means breaking fasts really late.
Ramadan Kareem is just a way of saying Happy Ramadan.

A muslim named Lil_Smok3r. How Allah would be so appreciative of someone.

Was I meant to laugh?
[/quote]
Why’d you only laugh when you’re high?[/quote]
BURN!

OT: may all of u fast while i enjoy this mcgangbang i got going on

Read full topic

item.title: Ramadan Kareem Everyone!
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Mubarak (I spell it mobarak) i believe means bless. I’m persian and we sing "Mobarak, mobarak, tavalod’ et mobarak, bia sham’aro fut kon, ke sad sol zendeh bashi. (and repeat) and this is Farsi. To english it would translate to “Bless, bless, bless your birthday, come and blow out the candles so you’ll live for one hundred years.”

I know Arabic has similarities to Farsi however Farsi and Arabic are mostly completely different.

Read full topic

item.title: Ramadan Kareem Everyone!
item.dc:creator: @Alias123 Alias123
item.description:
@Alias123 wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:12, topic:544424”][quote author=Alias123 link=topic=663304.msg4432898#msg4432898 date=1404070588]
Ramadan mubarak!! I am very excited to finally be able to fast! May Allah (Subhanahu Wa Ta’ala) make it easy for us all. Ameen! ﷲ ﺮﺒﻛأ
[/quote]

Can you tell me what these mean?

mubarak
Ameen!
ﷲ
(Subhanahu Wa Ta’ala)

I don’t get why you guys want to starve yourselves.[/quote]
Assalamu alaykum!

Ramadan mubarak means, "May your Ramadan be blessed."
Ameen is just, ameen!

The symbol means Allah. The other symbol means Allahu akbar! Which means god is the greatest! It’s Arabic.

Subhanahu Wa Ta’ala means The Glorified, or The Highest. You always say it after talking about Allah. (swt)

We don’t starve ourselves! We can eat before Fajr, and after Maghrib! (The sunrise and sunset prayer) We fast to celebrate, because Ramadan is the month in which the Holy Qur’an was revealed to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him)

Read full topic

item.title: Ramadan Kareem Everyone!
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:8, topic:544424”]Oh cool. Do you guys have your own new year too? Like the Chinese?

What are your months then too? If this is June is Eid July? How do you say September? Diwali?

Just curious.[/quote]
Islamic months are lunar, “January, February, March, April…” (etc.) are solar.

Read full topic

item.title: Ramadan Kareem Everyone!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:6, topic:544424”][quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=663304.msg4432837#msg4432837 date=1404051415]

What’s Ramadan Kareem?

Ramadan (a month in the Islamic calendar) is when Muslims fast.
I’m fasting today It’s really hard, since in the summer the sun sets really late, which means breaking fasts really late.
Ramadan Kareem is just a way of saying Happy Ramadan.
[/quote]
Is June called Ramadan in islam?

Is this like a contest were the person who fasts for the longest time gets a big reward or is it because you guys eat a lot and need that month to lose all those pounds gathered throughout the year?[/quote]
They have their own calendar following the moon. Ramadan falls on a different time every year.

Read full topic
